page.title: 05The Pier at Baltasound
page.content: It is difficult to imagine nowadays the busy scene at Baltasound pier at the height of the herring fishing. Unst's position in the North Sea made it a natural choice as a harbour for the hundreds of decked sailing boats working the herring season. By 1900 as many as 700 boats might be fishing from there.The small local community was swelled by the influx of workers- gutters,usually lassies who followed the trade to different Scotish ports, coopers and clerks. Photographs show the area all around the pier piled high with barrels,ready to be filled with salted herring.When the steam drifter took over from the sailing boat,Lerwick took over as the main fishing market.Nowadays,it is a safe harbour for stormbound boats but no boats now sail from this home pier.
